channel.title: U.S.-U.S.S.R. exchange programs
channel.description:
A series of program created within the Soviet Union for listeners in the United States. It is produced as part of a Soviet-American agreement for cultural exchange.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Soviet TV programs for the young
item.description: This program explores the types of programming that Soviet children view.
item.dc:creator: Radio Moskva (Radio station : Moscow)
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Yakutia
item.description: This program explores the Yakutia region of the Soviet Union.

item.title: Music appreciation in school
item.description: This program touts the important of music education in Soviet schools.

item.title: Breaking the Leningrad blockade
item.description: This program explores the story of the breaking of the Leningrad blockade.

item.title: Northern Folk Chorus
item.description: This program focuses on the Northern Folk Chorus, a Soviet choral group.
